conclusion: Analyze the image and conditions to determine the charge on the ball.
Two vertical parallel metal plates separated by distance \( d \). A small ball falls vertically, trajectory changes to 45° angle with vertical after voltage \( U \) is applied.
Initially, the ball falls vertically under gravity, so the force is downward.
When voltage \( U \) is applied, an electric field \( E \) is created, exerting force \( F_E \) on the ball perpendicular to the plates.
The force \( F_E \) is along the 45° angle \( BC \).
Force \( F_E = qE \), where \( q \) is the charge on the ball. Electric field \( E = \frac{U}{d} \).
Force due to gravity \( F_G = G \) is balanced by electric force \( F_E \) along 45° angle.
Substitute expressions for \( F_E \) and \( E \): \( G = q \frac{U}{d} \sqrt{2} \).
The charge amount of the small ball is \(\frac{Gd}{U\sqrt{2}}\).
